[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 158]
Reasoning: **Calculating poker scoring**

I'm at a small blind Ante of 7, needing 35k with 14,103 chips after one hand. I've got four hands left to gain 20,897 more chips. A decent hand could help, maybe two pairs or a full house. Right now, I have four hearts, so I could go for a flush. Also, I can make a high card with the Ace and face cards for extra chip value, considering scoring multipliers too. It looks like every played card counts in scoring, which is interesting!
**Analyzing poker scoring with Splash**

Okay, I realize that with Splash, every played card counts in scoring, even those not part of the "poker hand." This means I should focus on the best scoring effects rather than just building a strong hand. Currently, I have a high-card base of 25 chips with a multiplier of 3. I can't make a flush since I only have four hearts. A straight isn’t possible either. It looks like the best hand type I can play will still be a high card, so I should include the Ace for the best outcome.
**Calculating poker hand scoring**

I’m considering playing an Ace along with the four cards that create the best synergy: a King, Queen, and two even cards, 10 and 4. My hand type will be a high card with Ace as the high card. I calculate a base of 25 chips and a multiplier of 3. With Splash, all cards contribute their chips and effects. I’ve got a potential total of 130 chips factoring in enhancements and multipliers, plus an extra 50 chips from Splash foil. This could be quite a strong play!
**Examining Splash effects on scoring**

I’m realizing that Splash has a secondary effect that adds +50 chips, which seems to be an independent boost, similar to foil editions. So, if I include that, my total could rise to 180 chips. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}
